intro: Hieracium sillamaeense, commonly known as the Sillamae hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the eastern Mediterranean. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to harsh, arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat, disc-like structure. Hieracium sillamaeense is a relatively rare species, found primarily in specific microhabitats within its native range.
